message:
| my KGP Portal | - mykgp.com
A very happy new year to everyone. With the beginning of 2018, we have brought to you the one place portal for all the basic needs as a kgpian. Through the portal you can explore the Wikipedia of general items and events related to Kgp, emergency contact details, courses, previous year papers and many more. We will keep on adding more features soon.

Discover more by logging in to mykgp.com

| CREDITS |
Behind this portal lies the years of collections and efforts of metakgp. We thank Nischal, Technology Coordinator of Technology Students' Gymkhana for concluding the final portal. We also thank Naresh Ramesh for his continuous guidance.

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur and Business Club, IIT Kharagpur present the first round of the Indian Case Challenge 2018, one of the biggest case study competitions in India. Gear up to compete with the best minds in the country and prove your business acumen. Confronted with a real-life case scenario, just strong business skills and financial know-how won’t be enough. Only those with a spark of creativity and a zeal for realizing business opportunities will make it through. Wishing the best of luck to all participating teams!
The case will be sent to the registered teams via e-mail. The last date of submission for the preliminary round is 28th December 2017.
If you have not registered yet, head over to http://bclub.co.in/icc2018/register/

story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post.
message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Alumni Cell, IIT Kharagpur's post. In the wake of the recent tragic events that took place in KGP, Students’ Alumni Cell has taken an initiative along with IITKGP Foundation to raise INR 39 L ($60,000) to bring in state-of-the-art ambulance for safe and reliable medical care while en route to facilities in Kolkata. The surplus money raised will be used for student wellness and health on campus (namely mental health services). "Alumni are an integral part of the institute." True to our notions, they have always been a helping hand to KGP and have contributed significantly to its development over the years, be it the Nalanda Classroom complex or halls' development. It is in tough times like these, the true spirit of KGP emerges forth where the entire KGP family unites as a whole. As it is said in RK Hall, “A Great Place to Learn and Live,” let us make KGP a great place to learn and live. #for_a_better_kgp #every_help_counts

Greetings from Technology Students' Gymkhana!

The Smart India Hackathon (SIH) was a national level effort connecting the higher education campuses. The SIH was primarily a code-fest in which software programmers were challenged to write programmes giving innovative solutions to more than 500 problem statements. The SIH-2017 elicited an enthusiastic response with more than 40,000 students participating. It was concluded in the first week of April 2017 with Hon’ble PM addressing the participants. This is being followed with Smart India Hackathon-2018 which was formally launched details of which can be found in https://innovate.mygov.in/sih2018/.

The MHRD now proposes to expand the scope of SIH-2018 by including hardware section in it. This platform will provide an opportunity to the innovative minds to showcase their solutions at the national level. It is also proposed that the best entries at the national level would also be provided funding through the Research Parks and the Technology Business Incubators (TBIs) for product development for their eventual commercialisation/extensive social use.

The MHRD expects a good participation in this Hackathon from all the IITs and NITs.

All students are requested to provide ideas (with or without models/prototypes) that will be proposed as problem statements of the Smart India Hackathon 2018. This should be done by mailing the idea totech.gymkhana@gmail.com by 13th November, 2 AM.

You are also requested to go through the 400+ problem statements provided in the aforementioned link and register for the Hackathon. The problem statements are both software and hardware based.

A chance to experience Executive Decision Making while still in your student life.
iB Hubs has launched an online competition iB Hubs Student Challenge-Edition 1 for all students, to solve industry defined challenges.
It’s a competition to encourage students who aspire to excel in their career and are looking for opportunities to prove their mettle.
Challenge Start Date: 04:00 PM, 10th November with the release of problem statements through email
Team Size: Max of four members
Deadline for Submission: 09:00 PM,13th November.
Register at: ibhubs.co/student-challenge
Registrations are open throughout the challenge till 09:00 PM,13th November,2017.
For any queries, drop a mail to studentchallenge@ibhubs.co
#iBSC

Technology Student's Gymkhana is proud to bring Open Mic sessions for the KGPians, where you can come up with your gang to hang out or to perform anything that you like to display, it may be Standup, Sketches, Poems or anything you want to...

With the selections for the 2nd  Inter IIT Cultural meet going on , the selections for Stand Up Comedy will be based on the act that will be performed in this Open Mic session. 

All the Interested students who want to be a part of team for Stand Up Comedy in the cultural meet must fill the form-

YourDost for IIT Kharagpur is ready to kick off!

Be there in S.N. Bose Auditorium on 31st October, 2017 at 6pm!

story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared IIT KGP Sports's post.
message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared IIT KGP Sports's post. On the occasion of birth anniversary of Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel (First Home Minister of Independent India), Rashtriya Ekta Saptah is being celebrated across the country. To commemorate this, Technology Students’ Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur is organizing ‘RUN FOR UNITY’ on 31st October 2017 (Tuesday) at 5:45 a.m. The race will commence from TSG and after covering a distance of approximately five km, will end at TSG. You are cordially invited to take part in ‘RUN FOR UNITY’.

Technology Students’ Gymkhana, invites applications for being part of IIT Kharagpur’s contingent for the Inter IIT Cultural meet, 2017 to be held at IIT Kanpur from Dec 28, 2017 to Dec 30, 2017.
Interested students are requested to fill the forms for the events of their interest.

For Literary and Speaking Arts’ Events - http://tinyurl.com/kgp-lit
Captains – Lalit Khemlani (lalitkhemlani@gmail.com), Antra Saxena (antraanandsaxena@gmail.com)

For Quizzing Events - http://tinyurl.com/kgp-quizzing
Captain – Mayank Roy (roymayank@gmail.com)

For Dance Cup- http://tinyurl.com/kgp-dance
Captain – Ankit Singh (ankitsinghnunia122@gmail.com)

For Film and Media Cup - http://tinyurl.com/kgp-media
Captain – Abhineet Chute(abhineet.chute@gmail.com)

For Dramatics Cup - http://tinyurl.com/kgp-drams
Captain – Mayank Das(mayankdas6@gmail.com) , Apoorv Singhal (apoorv.singhal300@gmail.com)

For Music Cup - http://tinyurl.com/kgp-music
Captain - Sreekar Saripalli (sskgp05@gmail.com)

For Design (Fine Arts and Design) Cup - http://tinyurl.com/kgp-design
Captain - Aahan Tiwari (aahanaaravtiwari@gmail.com)

For any other information, you may contact:
Overall Contingent Leader – B K Vibhava(vibhubhat@gmail.com)
Deputy Contingent Leader – Harsh Kumar Sharan(harsh.k.sharan@gmail.com)

The deadline for application submission is 11 59 PM,  31st october, 2017

Technology Students' Gymkhana wishes you a very Happy Diwali.
And here comes the most awaited celebration of IIT KGP, illumination. All the Kgpian hearts have been eagerly throbbing for this festival of lights which unites the entire KGP family. Today, we would see thousands of diyas wiping off the darkness all around, the effort of every Kgpian being highlighted by the mighty chatais. It’s much more than a festival for us- the Kgpians. It symbolises the cultural variety, the linguistic differences of every fellow kgpian and the bonding that exists between them inspite of such differences. So, let's all come out together and celebrate Diwali in its true essence.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dheI2rtHIhU
Thanks to Branding And Relations Cell, IIT Kharagpur for thier assistance to make this video.

story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Hult Prize At IIT Kharagpur's post.
message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared Hult Prize At IIT Kharagpur's post. **IMPORTANT NOTICE** Hello everyone! The introductory seminar organized on 12th of October saw entrepreneurial enthusiasts turn up in large numbers despite the internship and placement tests happening at the same time. There have been some changes to the proceedings of the different rounds of Hult Prize this year from what was told in the seminar. In the words of the Director Hult Prize India, "There is a double opportunity from this year. Each campus winner goes to Regional Finals in March. One winner from each Regional Finals goes to the London accelerator. The India teams that are not the winners at Regional Finals, will have a National Finals in April-May. The National winner will also go to London accelerator. In addition, the Jury at India National Finals will include investors and industry experts bringing in, the potential for investment in ideas they like, irrespective of winning." There is another opportunity for you guys this year! Apply soon on the portal hultprizeat.com/iitkharagpur #HP18

Have you ever wondered how a global investment bank like Goldman Sachs uses the knowledge and skill of smart people like you to drive some of the most cutting edge innovations in the field of finance?

We bring to you GS Quantify 2017, an exciting computer science, quant and machine learning contest, where you will be tested on real-world problems from different areas of quantitative finance and analytics. The problems are hand-picked by us to give you a flavor of what we do every day, and demand an understanding and application of topics like optimization, linear algebra, stochastic calculus, data mining, algorithms, data structures and many more.
 
Join us for GS Quantify and compete against the best minds across the best engineering and science schools and stand a chance to win exciting prizes like iPhones, iPads, etc. Top teams get an all-expense paid trip to the Goldman Sachs Bengaluru office to present their solutions.
 
To read more about the previous edition of GS Quantify, please visit our Blog on GS Quantify 2016 Blogpost.
 
Eligibility Criteria:
-       Open to students of all years
-       Maximum of 3 participants per team 
REGISTRATIONS NOW OPEN!! EXCITING PRIZES TO BE WON!!
 
Last date for registration – October 7th

For more information and registrations, logon to https://www.hackerrank.com/gs-quantify-2017
 
For any queries, write to us at gs-quantify-2017@hackerrank.com
 
Feel free to spread the word with your fellow students.
Below is the link of the article that featured GS Quantify. 
http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/jobs/goldman-sachs-ups-tech-hiring-by-25-30-in-india/articleshow/60920934.cms
We look forward to your participation!

Hello All,

TSG invites applications for overall vice captains, cup-wise captain/vice-captain for INTER IIT CULTURAL MEET 2017(KANPUR, 28-30th Dec).Details of each cup are provided in the link.( https://gymkhana.iitb.ac.in/~cultural/interiit/)

Eligibility: Student having at least 2 years of experience at IIT Kharagpur, except those sitting for upcoming placements (2017-18).

Sample CV format is shown in the link (https://drive.google.com/file/d/0B-2KQCCDgrH-dzRTTHBKQ2hqeEhoVjZiWlNwZ19NdTMzWVY0/view?usp=sharing)

(All the CV’s should be in this format and should be emailed in PDF format).
All the applications should be emailed to tsg.socult@gmail.com by 5th October 2017, 11:59 PM. The selections will be made on the basis of CV’s and Interviews(if needed).
The subject of Mail: 
1.For Overall Vice captains
[OVERALL] APPLICATION FOR VICE CAPTAIN – NAME
2.For cup-wise captain/vice captain:
[CUP NAME] APPLICATION FOR CAPTAIN /VICE CAPTAIN – NAME 
e.g. [DRAMATICS] APPLICATION FOR CAPTAIN /VICE CAPTAIN – SHUBHAM JAIN

story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared IIT KGP Sports's post.
message: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur shared IIT KGP Sports's post. The Aquatics Contingent of IIT Kharagpur leaves today for the 33rd Inter IIT Aquatics Meet at Madras. The women’s swimming team led by Prutha Kale is high on confidence and is looking to better their previous year’s performance, where they finished third. Gitanshu Bhatia leads the well primed and poised men’s swimming team, while the two time defending champions, our water polo team with Abhishek Dahiya at the helm is all set to bring that trophy back to where it belongs. IIT KGP Sports wishes them all the very best! Your story. Our trophy. 🏆 #Go_For_Gold #MADrush!

The problem statements for the events have been released and can be found in the link below. Please go through them and send in your applications (CV and cover letter along with valid proof) at tech.gymkhana@gmail.com.

The subject of the mail should be [Problem Statement][Name][Roll No.].

Deadline: 03.10.2017, 12.30 AM

No applications after this deadline will be accepted under any circumstances.

story: Technology Students' Gymkhana, IIT Kharagpur added 3 new photos — with Nishchal Baghele and 8 others.
message: As the first initiative in the student welfare portfolio, the Technology Students' Gymkhana in association with Counselling Center, IIT Kharagpur organised a 2 day workshop on Gatekeepers training which helped students gain knowledge about detection of people with problems and how they should interact with them. The event saw a participation of around 65 students representing various halls of residences and Student Welfare Group, IIT Kharagpur. The event ended with paying condolences to the colleagues we lost last year and Prof.Somesh Kumar interacted with the students and discussed about the vision to work together for a better KGP.

A talk before mid semester examination.

"September 10th is World Suicide Prevention Day and to generate awareness around emotional and mental health, I Will by EpsyClinic is presenting an interactive talk on "Normalizing mental health" with an objective to remove stigma around mental health and to share a solution with people suffering from emotional or mental health issues. So Join us in SN Auditorium at 12 PM and play our roles in making IIT Kharagpur a happier place." 

All the students who wish to support this must be present.

Greetings from Teach For India!
 
Did you know?
In India, 4% of all children never start school
52% of 5th Standard students in a low income government school cannot read a 2nd standard textbook
48% of children drop out of school by 5th Standard
76% of students do not complete school and do not make it to college
​How can I sign up for the information session?
The 2018 Fellowship Application is now live and we are hoping to recruit leaders from your college for a 2 year, full time paid commitment.

We are going to be presenting at IIT Kharagpur on 7th Sept 2017 <Thursday> from 6:30 pm onwards at v1 (Vikramshila)

National Students’ Space Challenge, 2017 proudly presents Vikram Sarabhai Space Exhibition by Space Applications Centre, ISRO.

All students are requested to attend Vikramshila Complex to be a part of the exhibition. The exhibition is scheduled for 1-3 September, 2017 from 10 am to 6 pm. Set of panels related to Remote Sensing Satellites, Communication Satellite and their applications

1. Chandrayaan/ Mars mission, models of camera of Mars Mission, satellite images of Mars and Chandrayan

2. Scaled down models of launch vehicles like PSLV, GSLV and Mk III

3. Various satellite models of INSAT, IRS, Oceansat, Aryabhatta, Bhaskara, RISAT, Resourcesat, DAT, Apple, etc.

4. A working model showing satellites orbiting around earth.

5. Video documentaries show on mars mission and chandrayaan mission.

6. Videos on how to join ISRO - IIST

7. Mechanical / Electronic components, parts used in satellites will also be displayed.

8. ISRO’s Geo portal-BHUVAN website will be demonstrated during the exhibition.

Senior Scientist/Engineers from Space Applications Centre will remain present during the exhibition event & interact with visitors/students.

Hello!

GE is excited to invite you for GE Industrial Internet of Things hackathon - a private forum to encourage and recognize cool ideas that can revolutionize the IIoT. GE has bet big on the Industrial Internet — the convergence of industrial machines, data, and the Internet. We have installed sensors on gas turbines, jet engines, and other machines; connected them to the cloud; and are analyzing the resulting flow of data with an end goal to identify ways to improve machine productivity and reliability. Do you think you have the next BIG IDEA that will help us achieve our goals? Don your innovative hats and register to participate in the Hackathon! We are looking for talented developers who can build innovative solutions around IIoT, Smart City, Smart Machines, Healthcare. This hackathon is open to pre-final and final year engineering students of a select list of college (participating colleges), irrespective of the branch/ stream. Participate in this inter-collegiate hackathon and flaunt your innovative ideas!

Important dates:

Phase 1 (Idea phase) ends on 27th Aug
Phase 2 (Hackathon phase) shortlisted teams will build their application between 1st-24th Sep
Prizes:

Winning team stands a chance to win INR 1,00,000 worth gift cards and the top 3 teams stand a chance to win INR 50,000 gift cards
In addition, Top Teams stand a chance to work or Intern with GE Digital!
Happy Ideation!

For more updates visit the link: https://www.hackerearth.com/sprints/ge-digital-industrial-iot-hackathon

Your intangible assets might be of greater value than you realize! How well do you know about your right to protect your own creations of mind?
Do attend the “IPR Workshop: How Intellectual Property impacts life?” on 19th August 2017, 9 a.m. onwards at the Maitrayee Auditorium to know more about the legal rights you hold over the fruits of your intellect.
The sessions will be conducted by the likes of Hon'ble Justice S. Ravindra Bhatt, Prof. V. C. Vivekanandan, Hon'ble Justice Aniruddha Bose, Prof. Imtiaz Gulam Ahmed and Mr. Vineet Rohilla. Each session will be followed by an interactive Q & A session with the speakers.
Safeguard your intellectual properties. Don’t miss out.
Register yourself at tinyurl.com/IPRWorkshop17
Hurry! Limited seats are available.

Participate in the 4th edition of biggest innovation contest organized by KPIT Technologies and stand out as the ultimate pioneer.
All students from 1st year UG till Ph.D. are eligible.
Theme: “Next generation Energy and Transportation solutions” with special focus on: Artificial Intelligence | Cyber Security | New Materials.
Last Date to register is 17th August,2017. Registration is free of cost and get a chance to win awards over INR 21 Lakh.

IMS Learning Resources is an India-based training company preparing students for entrance examinations for competitive and professional courses. The Institute is conducting a "National Scholarship Test" to expose and encourage you to start your preparations early. Communiqué IIT Kharagpur, in association with IMS Learning Resources, is going to conduct this test in our campus.

The format of the Test:-
Type: Objective Questions (+3/-1)
Sections: Quantitative and Verbal Ability, Reading Comprehension, Data & Logical Reasoning
Time: 90 min

The test is free of cost and every student gets a scholarship from 10% to 100% on Classroom Programs depending on percentile and ranking.

Registration Link - https://goo.gl/forms/1zmnbDd9K6r3KxEo1
Eligibility - 2nd-year UG-5th year UG
Date - 23rd July, Sunday
Reporting time - 1:30 PM
Test Duration - 1.5 hrs ( 2 to 3:30 PM)
Venue - NR121, Nalanda Complex

ON SPOT REGISTRATIONS ARE AVAILABLE
